statement.p: An aircraft in flight has total energy given by \displaystyle{E}_{{T}}=\frac{{1}}{{2}}{m}{v}^{{2}}+{m}{g}{h} where
\displaystyle{m} is the mass of the aircraft in pounds
\displaystyle{h} is the height above sea level in feet
We want to know how the velocity changes when the height changes.
As altitude increase the velocity will

If needed try calculating velocities for two altitudes examples. For a glider with mass 1119 lbs and total energy 241950627.6, determine velocities at altitudes of \displaystyle{6600} and \displaystyle{6700} ft MSL.
